I highly recommend 'Insidious' to fans of suspense and horror. The film follows the life of Donny (Patrick Wilson) Rocchi, a talented twenty-one year old filmmaker who grew up in New York City.
Estranged from his mother, Donny never knew his dead father. Donny sets out to collect on debts owed, and is dragged deep into a seductive ambush that turns his world upside down.
Donny reaches out for help from a "connected" Mulberry Street café owner, Gigetto (Angus Sampson), who has more problems than just the Russian mob.
Insidious is a compelling and riveting story of desperation and betrayal, as Donny faces a fight for truth, love, and life itself.
